BE2-1139436-8 23 (t) No Merger. So long as any Qualified Leasehold Mortgage is in existence, unless all Permitted Mortgagees under all Qualified Leasehold Mortgages shall otherwise expressly consent in writing, the fee title to the Demised Premises and LESSEE's leasehold interest in the Demised Premises shall not merge, but shall remain separate and distinct, notwithstanding the acquisition of said fee title, and said leasehold interest by LESSOR or by LESSEE or by a third party, by purchase or otherwise. (u) Notices. Notices from LESSOR to a Permitted Mortgagee under a Qualified Leasehold Mortgage pursuant to any provision of this Section 19 shall be given to such Permitted Mortgagee at the address set forth in the last notice to LESSOR pursuant to clauses (i)(1), (i)(2) or (i)(3), whichever applies, of this Section 19, in the manner set forth in Section 37 of this Lease. Notices from any Permitted Mortgagee under a Qualified Leasehold Mortgage, its Affiliate or designee to LESSOR shall be given to the address and in the manner set forth in Section 37 of this Lease. 20. MECHANICS LIENS. If, as a result of any such additions, alterations, improvements, repairs or replacements (hereinafter in this paragraph referred to as the "construction"), the Demised Premises or any part thereof shall at any time during the Lease term or any renewal term hereof, become subject to any vendor's, mechanic's, laborer's, materialmen's or other similar liens based upon furnishing of materials or labor to the Demised Premises and not contracted for by LESSOR, LESSEE shall cause the same to be discharged by bonding, or in any other lawful manner, at its sole cost and expense within sixty (60) days after LESSEE shall have actual notice of the existence thereof. If LESSEE fails to discharge such liens within said sixty (60) day period, LESSOR may, * subject to the rights of any Permitted Mortgagee under a Qualified Mortgage at any time thereafter while the lien remains undischarged, terminate this Lease effective immediately upon notice and re- enter the Demised Premises and enjoy the same as if this Lease had not been made, and thereupon this Lease and everything contained herein shall terminate, without prejudice, however, to the rights of LESSOR under Section 26 (Estoppel Certificates) of this Lease. For the purpose of this section, mortgagee shall mean only those mortgagees of which LESSOR has approved, in accordance with Section 19 (Leasehold Mortgages and Mortgagee's Rights). Notice is hereby given that LESSOR shall not be liable for any work performed or to be Performed on the Demised Premises, or in any building or improvements thereon, or in connection with any appurtenance thereto, for LESSEE or any Sublessee, or for any materials furnished or to be furnished at the Demised Premises for LESSEE or any Sublessee, and that no mechanic's or other lien for such work or materials shall attach to the reversionary or other interest of LESSOR. 21. UTILITIES AND ACCESS. LESSEE shall pay all charges for the installation of utility service lines from the points of connection shown in Exhibit D-1 attached hereto, and all utilities (including, but not limited to, gas, electric, water, sewer, and communications) furnished to the Demised Premises during the initial and any additional term of this Lease. LESSEE shall have the right to install such utility service lines under and through other lands of LESSOR so as to enable LESSEE to have such utility services, with the location of such lines being subject to the approval of LESSOR, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld. LESSOR agrees that LESSEE may connect into BE2-1139436-8 24 LESSOR's storm sewers, sanitary sewers, natural gas lines, and water lines, in which case LESSOR shall provide LESSEE with such utility service at a per unit cost equal to the per unit cost which LESSOR pays to the provider of such utility. LESSOR shall not be responsible for the quality, quantity, interruption or failure in the supply of any utility to the Demised Premises which is not provided by LESSOR when said supply is so affected as a result of conditions beyond the control of LESSOR. LESSOR shall not be liable for any reduction of the quality or quantity of or for the interruption of any utility service provided by LESSOR which is caused by conditions beyond the control of LESSOR, but LESSOR shall restore such utility service to the proper quality and quantity as soon as reasonably possible. LESSEE shall pay all tap fees and capacity charges which must be paid any utility in order to connect the improvements on the Demised Premises to such utility or to provide service to the Demised Premises. During the term of this Lease, LESSOR shall not sell, lease, or encumber any of its land over or through which utilities serving the Demised Premises are located unless LESSOR first reserves an easement of record for the benefit of the Demised Premises and LESSEE for the use, operation, repair, maintenance and replacement of such utilities. Installation and servicing of telephone service to the Premises, including all dedicated communication lines, shall be provided, at LESSOR's expense (except for the cost of labor and materials for the installation of the conduit from the nearest available point of connection, which shall be paid by LESSEE), by UNITS, LESSOR's telephone service division, unless UNITS is unable to provide LESSEE the required service at a competitive cost. In no event shall the telephone equipment installed be incompatible with UNITS. LESSEE and its invitees and employees shall have the right of vehicular and pedestrian ingress and egress between the Demised Premises and one or more publicly dedicated roads over Carmack Road, the service road immediately south of the Demised Premises, and other roads which are from time to time within LESSOR's research park. LESSOR shall have the right to relocate Carmack Road or the service road immediately south of the Demised Premises so long as LESSEE has similar and equivalent vehicular and pedestrian access between Lane Avenue and the parking areas of the Demised Premises. In the event LESSOR develops any of the land to the East of the Demised Premises (the "easterly land"), and wishes to utilize the entrance drive on the East side of the Demised Premises (the "drive") for access thereto. LESSOR will, at LESSEE's request and at LESSOR'S sole cost, expand the drive sufficiently to accomodate traffic to the easterly land. LESSOR shall have a non-exclusive right to use the drive for vehicular and pedestrian access to facilities used for academic, research, or office purposes on the easterly land. Upon the commencement of such use, the parties shall cooperate in good faith to determine an equitable basis for sharing the repair and maintenance costs of the drive, provided, however, LESSOR will pay for any repairs to damage caused by construction traffic. In the event LESSOR expands the drive, LESSEE shall have a non-exclusive right to use those portions of the drive which are not within the Demised Premises for for vehicular and pedestrian access to the improvements constructed on the Demised Premises. 22. ASSIGNMENT AND SUBLETTING BY LESSEE. Except as otherwise set forth in Section 19 above, LESSEE shall not, without the prior written consent of LESSOR, which consent LESSOR shall not unreasonably withhold, assign or transfer its interests under this Lease in whole or in part or sublet all or any part of the Demised Premises. If LESSEE is a corporation, any transfer of this Lease from LESSEE by merger, consolidation or liquidation shall constitute an assignment for the purpose of this Lease and shall require the written consent of LESSOR. Any consent by LESSOR to any BE2-1139436-8 25 assignment or subletting shall not constitute a waiver of the necessity of such consent to any subsequent assignment or subletting. Each assignee or transferee shall assume and be deemed to have assumed this Lease and shall remain liable jointly and severally with LESSEE for the payment of all rent and for the due performance of all the terms, covenants, conditions and agreements herein contained on LESSEE's part to be paid and performed for the term of this Lease. No assignment shall be binding on LESSOR unless such assignee or LESSEE shall deliver to LESSOR a counterpart of such assignment and an instrument in recordable form which contains a covenant of assumption by the assignee. No assignment or subletting by LESSEE with the consent of LESSOR shall relieve LESSEE of its obligations hereunder unless LESSOR expressly so agrees in writing. 23. RIGHT OF FIRST REFUSAL; ATTORNMENT BY LESSEE LESSOR has the unrestricted right to assign its interests under this Lease or to sell or convey the Demised Premises, subject to the following right of first refusal of LESSEE. Prior to LESSOR assigning its interest in this Lease and selling its fee simple interest in the Demised Premises, LESSOR shall notify LESSEE of the terms and conditions of such sale. LESSEE shall have thirty (30) days after receipt of such terms to notify LESSOR that LESSEE will purchase such interests under such terms, in which case LESSOR shall sell such interests to LESSEE. If LESSEE notifies LESSOR that LESSEE does not want to purchase such interests, or if LESSEE does not respond to LESSOR's notice of the terms within said thirty (30) days, LESSOR may sell such interests to a third party upon said terms within twelve months. If LESSOR decides to sell such interests on terms more favorable to the purchaser than those contained in LESSEE's notice, or if LESSOR decides to sell such interests on the terms contained in the notice after twelve months have elapsed since LESSEE's initial right to purchase was declined or lapsed, then LESSOR shall notify LESSEE of such terms and LESSEE shall have another thirty days to elect to purchase said interests. Upon receiving notice of a conveyance to a third party after compliance with the foregoing provisions, LESSEE agrees to recognize the new owner as LESSOR hereunder and will continue to be bound by the terms and conditions of this Lease. 24. RESPONSIBILITY FOR LIABILITY. LESSEE shall assume the risk of and be responsible for any loss, damage or injury to person (including death) or property occurring in, on or about the Demised Premises, to the extent that such loss, damage or injury results from the negligence of LESSEE, its employees or agents while acting within the scope of their employment. 25. LESSORS ACCESS TO DEMISED PREMISES. Upon twenty-four (24) hours prior written notice LESSOR and/or LESSOR's agent may enter upon the Demised Premises for determining the need for repairs and replacements as provided for in Section 12 (Maintenance and Repair), and also for making repairs and replacements to the Demised Premises as provided for in Section 12 (Maintenance and Repair) herein after also giving the notice required under Section 12. 26. ESTOPPEL CERTIFICATES. LESSOR shall at any time and from time to time, upon not less than thirty (30) day prior written notice from LESSEE or any Permitted Mortgagee under a Qualified Leasehold Mortgage, as such terms are defined under Section 19, execute, acknowledge and deliver to LESSEE or such Permitted Mortgagee, as the case may be, a statement in writing certifying that this Lease is unmodified and in full force and effect, or if there has been any modification thereof, that the same is in full force and effect as modified and identifying the modification or modifications; that BE2-139436-8 26 there are no existing defaults, or if there is any claimed default, stating the nature and extent thereof; and stating the dates to which the rent and other charges have been paid in advance. LESSEE shall at any time and from time to time at LESSOR's request, with thirty (30) days prior written notice, provide a similar statement certifying the same type of information to LESSOR. It is expressly understood and agreed that any such writing pursuant to this Section may be relied upon by any prospective assignee or sublessee of the leasehold estate of LESSEE or any prospective purchaser of the estate of LESSOR; or any lender on the security of the Demised Premises or any part thereof. 27. DEFAULT; TERMINATION. If at any time during the term of this Lease with respect to the Demised Premises (i) LESSEE shall default in the payment of any rent or of any other sum of money which LESSEE shall be obligated to pay under the provisions of this Lease to LESSOR or others, for fifteen (15) days after notice that the same is due and unpaid; (ii) LESSEE shall suffer a declaration by a Permitted Mortgagee under a Qualified Leasehold Mortgage that all amounts secured by the same are due and payable and LESSOR shall purchase all of the interests of such Permitted Mortgagee in such Leasehold Mortgage, all as provided in Section 19(n)(1); (iii) LESSEE's activities on the Demised Premises shall be deemed by a public health official or agency as a public health risk or public nuisance, and LESSEE, after being notified of such public health risk or public nuisance, fails to promptly begin remedying or eliminating the risk or nuisance or to thereafter diligently proceed to remedy or eliminate such risk or nuisance; or (iv) LESSEE shall default in the performance or observance of any of the other terms, covenants, conditions or agreements of this Lease for thirty (30) days after written notice and demand, or if such default shall be of such a nature that the same cannot practicably be cured within said thirty (30) day period, LESSEE shall not within said period commence with due diligence and dispatch the curing and performance of such defaulted term, covenant, condition or agreement, or if LESSEE shall within said thirty (30) day period commence with due diligence and dispatch to cure and perform such defaulted term, covenant, condition or agreement and shall thereafter fail or neglect to prosecute and complete with due diligence and dispatch the curing and performance of such defaulted term, covenant, condition or agreement; then and in any such case, LESSOR, at LESSOR's option, may elect, subject to Section 19 hereof, to terminate this Lease at any time by giving ten (10) days notice in writing to LESSEE, and the term of this Lease as to the Demised Premises shall expire by limitation at the expiration of said last mentioned ten (10) days notice as fully and completely as if said date were the date herein originally fixed for the expiration of the term hereby granted, and LESSEE shall thereupon quit and peacefully surrender the Demised Premises and improvements (subject to any rights of LESSEE's mortgagee or mortgagees) to LESSOR, without any payment therefore by LESSOR, and LESSOR, upon the expiration of said last mentioned ten (10) days notice, or at any time thereafter, may re-enter that parcel of the Demised Premised and remove all persons and property therefrom by any suitable action or proceeding at law or equity, without being liable in damages therefor, and may have, hold and enjoy the Demised Premises and improvements. If LESSOR shall obtain possession of the Demised Premises by reason of or following any default of LESSEE, LESSEE agrees to pay to LESSOR on demand all expenses incurred by LESSOR in obtaining possession, in altering, repairing and putting the Demised Premises in good order and condition, and in reletting the same, including reasonable fees of architects, attorneys and agents, and also any other expenses and commissions, and LESSEE further agrees to pay as damages to LESSOR upon the rent days specified herein in each year following any termination of this Lease by reason of a BE2-1139436-8 27 default of LESSEE hereunder, until the end of the period which would have constituted the term of this Lease had this Lease not so terminated, the rent and all other sums of money whatsoever which would have been payable by LESSEE during such period, deducting only the net amount of rent, if any, which LESSOR shall actually receive (after deducting therefrom all expenses and costs of operation and maintenance of the Demised Premises and improvements) in the meantime from any reletting of the Demised Premises, and LESSEE hereby agrees to be and remain liable for all sums aforesaid as well as for any deficiency therein, and LESSOR shall have the right from time to time to bring and maintain successive actions or other legal proceedings against LESSEE for the recovery of such deficiency, deficiencies or damages or for sums equal to any installment or installments of rent, and to recover such sums upon the liability of LESSEE herein provided, which liability it is expressly covenanted shall survive the termination of this Lease. Nothing herein contained shall be deemed to require LESSOR to wait to bring such action, actions or other legal proceedings until the date when this LEASE would have expired had there been no such default by LESSEE. In reletting the Demised Premises as aforesaid, LESSOR may make leases and lettings of the whole of the Demised Premises, for a term or terms equal to or less than the term hereof, and for a rental or rentals and upon such terms, conditions, covenants agreements and provisions as LESSOR may elect. LESSOR hereby agrees to use its best efforts in reletting the Demised Premises in such a manner as shall maximize the amount of rent obtained therefrom. The rights of LESSOR under this paragraph shall be in addition to LESSOR's right to collect any other damages from LESSEE by reason of LESSEE's default under this Lease. Notwithstanding the provisions of this provision, LESSOR shall not be entitled to any of the costs, expenses, or damages set forth in this paragraph if immediately prior to and upon the termination of this Lease there is no mortgage or lien upon LESSEE's interest in this Lease or the Demised Premises. No receipt of money or any property or thing of value by LESSOR from LESSEE after a termination of this Lease by LESSOR shall reinstate, continue or extend the terms of this Lease or affect any notice theretofore given to LESSEE, or operate as a waiver of the right of LESSOR to enforce the payment of rent and additional rent then due or thereafter falling due, it being agreed that after the commencement of suit, or after final order or judgment, for the possession of the Demised Premises, LESSOR may demand, receive and collect any money due or thereafter falling due without in any manner affecting such suit, proceeding order or judgment, all such moneys collected being deemed payments on account of the use and occupation of the Demised Premises, or at the election of LESSOR, on account of LESSEE's liability hereunder. LESSOR shall have, receive and enjoy as LESSOR's sole and absolute property, without right or duty to account therefor to LESSEE, any and all sums collected by LESSOR as rent or otherwise upon reletting the Demised Premises after LESSOR shall resume possession thereof as hereinbefore provided, including, without limitation upon the generality of the foregoing, any amounts by which the sum or sums so collected shall exceed the continuing liability of LESSEE hereunder. The word "re-enter," as used in this Lease, is not and shall not be restricted to its technical meaning but is and shall be construed in its broadest sense. 28. QUIET ENJOYMENT. So long as LESSEE shall promptly pay the rents and keep and perform the terms, covenants and conditions of this Lease on its part to be kept and performed, LESSEE shall peaceably and quietly hold, occupy and enjoy the Demised Premises during the initial and any additional term hereof, without let, hindrance or molestation from LESSOR or by any person lawfully BE2-139436-8 28 claiming through or under LESSOR. LESSOR represents and warrants that LESSOR holds marketable fee simple title to the Demised Premises. 29. RESTORATION OF DEMISED PREMISES. Upon termination of this Lease or upon termination of a New Lease entered pursuant to Section 19 hereof, but in no event earlier than Forty (40) years after the date of this Lease, LESSOR shall have the option to have the improvements made to the Demised Premises in accordance with Section 11 (Alterations and Improvements) hereof removed and the Demised Premises restored to the condition in which it was delivered to LESSEE at the beginning of the term of this Lease. Upon notice to LESSEE from LESSOR of LESSOR's decision to exercise its option to have the improvements removed and the Demised Premises restored, which notice shall be given within thirty (30) days after the termination of this Lease, LESSEE shall cause the same to be done no later than One Hundred Twenty (120) days after the expiration of LESSEE's leasehold estate, subject to the provisions of Section 33 (Acts Beyond the Control of Lessee or Lessor) hereof regarding acts beyond the control of LESSEE. Should LESSEE fail to cause the improvements to be removed and the Demised Premises restored within one hundred twenty (120) days after expiration of LESSEE's leasehold, LESSOR may, but shall not be required to, cause the same to be done. Any funds in the Capital Replacement Reserve Account shall be applied to the cost of removing the improvements and restoring the Demised Premises. If the funds in the Capital Replacement Reserve Account are not sufficient to cover the cost of removing the improvements and restoring the Demised Premises, then the balance of the cost of such removal and restoration shall be divided between LESSOR and LESSEE in proportion to the percentage of the area of the improvements then occupied by each. In the event that there are funds remaining in the Capital Replacement Reserve Account after paying therefrom the costs of such removal and restoration, LESSOR and LESSEE shall divide all remaining funds within the Capital Replacement Reserve Account between them in proportion to the amount contributed by each. 30. NET LEASE. This is an absolutely net Lease and LESSOR shall not be requested to provide any services or do any act or thing with respect to the Demised Premises, or the buildings and improvements thereon, or the appurtenances thereto, except as may be specifically provided herein, and the rent reserved herein shall be paid hereunder, except as otherwise specifically provided in this Lease. 31. EMPLOYMENT. During the initial term of this Lease and any subsequent renewal periods, LESSEE shall not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment with respect to hiring, promotion, termination, pay, job assignment or any other working condition because of race, sex, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, Vietnam veterans status, or disability. The foregoing provision shall not create any private cause of action or any third party beneficiary rights, and are solely for the benefit of and enforceable by LESSOR. 32. ACCORD AND SATISFACTION. No payment by LESSEE or receipt by LESSOR of a lesser amount than the yearly rent herein stipulated shall be deemed to be other than on account of the BE2-1139436-8 29 stipulated rent, nor shall any endorsement or statement or any check or any letter accompanying any check or payment as rent be deemed an accord and satisfaction, and LESSOR may accept such check or payment without prejudice to LESSOR's right to recover the balance of such rent or pursue any other remedies in this Lease provided. 33. ACTS BEYOND CONTROL OF LESSOR OR LESSEE. In the event that LESSOR or LESSEE shall be delayed or hindered or prevented from the performance of any act required hereunder by reason of strikes, lock-outs, labor troubles, inability to procure materials, failure of power, inadequate power, restrictive governmental laws or regulations, severe weather conditions, disaster, riots, insurrection, war or other reason of a like nature not the fault of LESSOR or LESSEE in performing work or doing acts required under the terms of this Lease, the performance of such acts shall be excused for the period of the delay. This provision shall not operate to excuse LESSEE from prompt payment of rent or any other payments required by the terms of this Lease. 34. SUBMISSION OF LEASE. The submission of this Lease for examination does not constitute an offer to lease, and this Lease becomes effective only upon execution thereof by LESSOR and LESSEE. 35. ADVERTISING. Each party hereto agrees that it shall not advertise any connection with the other nor make use of the other's name or other identifying marks or property nor make representation, either express or implied, as to the other's promotion or endorsement of such party's operation unless it has received prior written permission from the other (with such permission by LESSOR being from LESSOR's Office of Business and Administration). Any permitted advertising which indicates any connection to LESSOR must comply with LESSOR's policy. LESSEE shall submit any proposed advertising for review by LESSOR, no less than fourteen (14) days before placement of said advertising. LESSOR may request any changes in said advertising in order to comply with LESSOR's policy. The above restrictions shall not apply to use of the LESSOR's name solely for the purpose of identifying LESSEE's location on the Demised Premises. 36. HOLDING OVER. If LESSEE or any party claiming under LESSEE, continues in possession of the Demised Premises or any part thereof, beyond the termination of this Lease, LESSEE shall be considered a tenant from month to month only and shall pay as rental for each month LESSEE's tenancy continues beyond the termination of this Lease, the sum equal to the monthly Fair Market Rental Rate (as defined in Section 7 above). 37. NOTICE. Any notice required by this Lease to be given by either LESSOR or LESSEE to the other shall be in writing, sent by certified mail, return receipt requested and deemed to be given when deposited in the United States mail, postage prepaid, addressed to LESSOR or LESSEE at their respective addresses as follows: BE2-1139436-8 30 ## If to LESSOR: The Ohio State University Real Estate and Property Management Division 2080 Neil Avenue Columbus, Ohio 43210-1115 Telephone: 614-292-0770 or at such other address as LESSOR may give notice of to LESSEE. | If to LESSEE: | If to LESSEE: | |-|-| | | Edison Welding Institute | | | 1100 Kinnear Road | | | Columbus, Ohio 43212 | | | Attn: Executive Director | | | Telephone: 614-486-9400 | or at such other address as LESSEE may give notice of to LESSOR. 38. HEADINGS. It is understood and agreed that the headings of the various Sections of this Lease have been inserted only as a matter of convenience and for reference and in no way define, limit, or describe the scope or intent of this Lease or any of its provisions. The singular number and gender of personal pronouns as used throughout this Lease shall be construed to mean such number and gender of personal pronouns as the context, circumstances or its antecedent may require. 39. SUCCESSORS AND ASSIGNS. Any term, covenant or condition of this Lease which inures to the benefit of or is binding upon LESSOR shall also inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the successors and assigns of LESSOR. Any term, covenant or condition of this Lease which inures to the benefit of or is binding upon LESSEE shall also inure to the benefit of and be binding upon the successors and assigns of LESSEE. 40. ENTIRE AGREEMENT. This Lease constitutes the entire agreement between LESSOR and LESSEE in respect of the subject matter thereof and this Lease supersedes all prior and contemporaneous leases and agreements, if any, between LESSOR and LESSEE in connection with the subject matter of this Lease. This Lease may be modified only by a writing signed by both LESSOR and LESSEE. 41. CONDITIONS AND COVENANTS. All of the provisions of this Lease shall be deemed as running with the land, and construed to be "conditions" as well as "covenants" as though the words specifically expressing or imparting covenants and conditions were used in each separate provision. 42. WAIVER. No failure by either LESSOR or LESSEE to insist upon the strict performance by the other of any covenant, agreement, term, or condition of this Lease or to exercise any right or remedy contingent upon a breach thereof shall constitute a waiver of any such breach or of such covenant, BE2-139436-8 31 condition, agreement, and the term of this Lease shall continue in full force and effect with respect to any other then existing or subsequent breach. 43. TIME OF ESSENCE. Time is of the essence of this Lease and of each provision hereof. 44. COMPUTATION OF TIME. The time in which any act provided by this Lease is to be done is computed by excluding the first day and including the last, unless the last day is a Saturday, Sunday, or legal holiday, and then it is also excluded. 45. RELATIONSHIP OF LESSOR TO LESSEE. Nothing contained in this Lease shall be deemed or construed by the parties or by any third person to create the relationship of principal and agent or of partnership or of joint venture or of any association between LESSOR and LESSEE, and neither the method of computation of rent nor any other provisions contained in this Lease nor any acts of the parties shall be deemed to create any relationship between LESSOR and LESSEE. 46. INTERPRETATION AND DEFINITIONS. The language in all parts of this Lease shall in all cases be simply construed according to its fair meaning and not strictly for or against LESSOR or LESSEE. 47. COUNTERPARTS. This Lease, consisting of Thirty six (36) pages, plus six (6) exhibits, has been executed by the parties in several counterparts, each of which shall be deemed to be an original copy. 48. RECORDING. LESSOR and LESSEE shall, concurrent with the execution of this Lease, execute, acknowledge and record the Memorandum of Lease attached as Exhibit E. 49. EXHIBITS. This Lease has six (6) Exhibits attached hereto and referred to herein, identified as follows: Exhibit A Legal Description of Demised Premises and Survey Exhibit B Agreement on Cooperation Exhibit C Rules and Regulations Exhibit D Approved Plans and Specifications (Signed April 10, 1995 but not attached due to size; incorporated by reference herein.) Exhibit E Memorandum of Lease 50. COMMISSIONS. Any commissions, broker fees, finders' fees or other financial obligations due and owing or that become due and owing to any third party as a result of LESSOR and LESSEE entering into this Lease of the Demised Premises shall be the sole responsibility of the LESSEE, and LESSEE shall indemnify and save and hold LESSOR harmless for any such obligations. LESSOR represents to LESSEE that LESSOR has not dealt with any brokers in connection with this transaction and is not aware that any commission is due any third party as a result of this Lease. BE2-1139436-8 32 51. SIGNS. LESSEE shall be permitted to place on the Demised Premises signs advertising LESSEE's business and entry signs. LESSEE's exterior signage shall comply with all laws, ordinances, etc. which shall apply to said signs. LESSEE will not place or cause to be placed or maintained on or about the exterior of the Demised Premises, any sign, advertising matter or other thing of any kind and will not place or maintain any decoration, lettering or advertising matter on the glass of any window or door of the Demised Premises which is not approved by LESSOR, which approval shall not be unreasonably withheld, and LESSEE will maintain such sign, decoration, lettering, advertising matter or other thing in good condition and repair at all times. 52. GOVERNMENTAL REGULATIONS. LESSEE shall comply with all laws, ordinances and regulations of the Government of the United States, State of Ohio, and county and municipal authorities with respect to the use, occupancy, construction, or maintenance of the Premises and site by LESSEE. These laws, ordinances, and regulations include (but are not limited to) those prohibiting discrimination and those requiring payment of "prevailing wages" and participation of minority businesses in construction of improvements. 53. GOVERNING LAW. This Lease shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Ohio. Any legal action arising out of this Lease shall be brought in a court of competent jurisdiction in the State of Ohio. 54. SEVERABILITY. If any provisions of this Lease or any application thereof shall be invalid or unenforceable, the remainder of this Lease and any other application of such provision shall not be affected thereby. 55. PREVAILING WAGE. All initial construction, and any later alterations, additions, substitutions, and improvements shall meet all governmental laws, ordinances, statutes, regulations, and codes that are applicable to such work. In all construction on the Demised Premises LESSEE shall comply with Chapter 4115 of the Ohio Revised Code dealing with wages and hours on Public Improvements, and in all contracts with any subcontractors for such construction, LESSEE shall include a provision that the prevailing wage rates of the locality as determined by the Department of Industrial Relations pursuant to Chapter 4115 shall control the contract wages. 56. NON-DISCRIMINATION. During the term of this Lease, LESSEE shall operate the Premises without discrimination as to race, creed, color, age, sex, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, Vietnam veterans status, or disability with respect to its employees, vendors, contractors, business invitees, and guests. The foregoing provision shall not create any private cause of action or any third party beneficiary rights, and are solely for the benefit of and enforceable by LESSOR. 57. BONDING. Upon execution of this Lease, and until all improvements pursuant to Section 11 are completed, LESSEE shall deposit with LESSOR Labor and Material Payment and Performance Bonds, written by a surety company reasonably satisfactory to LESSOR and licensed to write such bonds in Ohio, each in an amount equal to the total cost of the construction of the improvements, to BE2-139436-8 33 secure the completion of the improvements under Section 11. Such bonds may be bonds by LESSEE's construction manager and/or LESSEE's prime contractors, in which case LESSOR and LESSEE shall be dual obligees under such bonds. 58. EASEMENTS. LESSEE's use of the Demised Premises shall be subject to and restricted by any preexisting easements which LESSOR has granted relative to the premises. 59. FINANCING CONTINGENCY. All of the obligations of LESSEE hereunder are subject to and contingent upon the successful closing by LESSEE of all financing required for the construction of the Edison Joining Technology Center on or before October 1, 1995. BE2-139436-8 35 t: B # MEMORANDUM OF APPROVAL # Lease of Land to the Edison Welding Institute On August 3, 1994, and October 7, 1994, the Board of Trustees adopted resolutions authorizing the lease of land to the Edison Welding Institute for the purpose of constructing and operating a new Edison Joining Technology Center and providing for the University's lease of space in that facility. On February 17,1995, the Board of Directors of The Ohio State University Research Foundation adopted a resolution accepting appointment as the University's agent to execute this lease if so requested by the University. On March 3, 1995, the Board of Trustees adopted resolutions authorizing the University to appoint and direct The Ohio State University Research Foundation as the agent of The Ohio State university to negotiate and execute a long-term land lease with the Edison Welding Institute for the construction of the Edison Joining Technology Center on such terms and conditions as were set forth in the prior resolutions adopted by the Board. The undersigned officials certify that their offices have reviewed the proposed land lease dated April 10, 1995 between the Edison Welding Institute and The Ohio State University Research Foundation, acting as agent for The Ohio State University; that this land lease conforms to the terms and conditions set forth in the resolutions adopted by the Board of Trustees on August 3 and October 7, 1994; and that, in accordance with the resolution adopted by the Board of Trustees on March 3, 1995, The Ohio State University Research Foundation is authorized and directed to enter into this proposed lease as the agent of The Ohio State University. !! ........................................................................................................ BE2-1139436-8 2/7/95 ## MEMORANDUM OF LAND LEASE THIS MEMORANDUM OF LAND LEASE, made as of the 1st day of April, 1995, by and between THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY ("Lessor") acting by and through THE OHIO STATE UNIVERSITY RESEARCH FOUNDATION, its Agent, having an address at Real Estate and Property Management Division, 2080 Neil Avenue, Columbus, Ohio 43210-1115, and EDISON WELDING INSTITUTE, INC., an Ohio non-profit corporation ("Lessee") of 1100 Kinnear Road, Columbus, Ohio 43212, Attn: Executive Director. Lessor has leased and let to Lessee, and Lessee has leased and let from Lessor certain real property located in the City of Columbus, Franklin County, Ohio, and described in Exhibit A attached hereto and made a part hereof (the "Demised Premises"), to have and to hold the Demised Premises at the rentals and upon and subject to the terms, covenants, conditions and agreements as more particularly set forth in that certain unrecorded land lease dated April 1, 1995, by and between Lessor and Lessee (the "Lease") for an initial term of twenty five (25) years, commencing on April 1, 1995. Said Lease provides for three (3) renewal terms of five (5) additional years each for a total potential term of forty (40) years. The Lease contains a right of first refusal for the benefit of Lessee in the event Lessor elects to sell the Demised Premises. The Lease also contains a requirement that, prior to selling, leasing, or encumbering any of Lessor's adjacent land over or through which utilities serving the Demised Premises are located, Lessor shall reserve an easement of record for the benefit of Lessee and the Demised Premises for the use, operation, repair, maintenance and replacement of such utilities. The purpose of recording this Memorandum of Land Lease is to give notice of the existence of the Lease and of the rights granted therein by Lessor to Lessee.
